discourse_list.title: [Proposal] Gitcoin Anti-Fraud Stewards Draft Grant Proposal

content.content: Hi folks!  The gitcoin Anti-Fraud stewards are also building a proposal to be submitted before the close of GR10.  The proposal is still in rough form but here is a link for anyone interested to take a look.  Feedback is welcomed.  The proposal is addressing rewards for:  Communications  Operations  Grant Verification & Oversight  Human Participation in Machine Learning Algorithms  Policy Documentation for Round 10 anti-fraud organisation.    https://docs.google.com/document/d/1L4CIJXosoCEYlaQauBPtLbvKlCTWB7HG-Q26WDYXBK4/edit?usp=sharing  The group is having weekly meetings on Tuesdays at 2200h CET.  Drop by the meetings if interested.  https://gitcoin.co/grants/3130/gitcoin-dao-anti-fraud-workstream-round-10
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is sharing a draft grant proposal for Gitcoin Anti-Fraud Stewards and is asking for feedback. The proposal aims to address rewards for various aspects of anti-fraud organization. The author also invites interested parties to attend weekly meetings. A 3rd party can give constructive criticism or ask questions about the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Hello @David_Dyor! Thank you for the proposal. I have some questions about the doc.  Shaping the future of anti sybil: Work in gamifying the approvals process, working with other DAOs to provide heads up about users found to colluding  How do you identify a user in this case? That’s the entire problem of sybil. It’s just an ethereum address. They just abandon it and make another one. So what user data would you forward to other DAOs?  Operational functions of fraud detection  That section needs better formatting and re-wording a bit. I found it quite hard to read and understand. At least split the subsections into their own paragraphs.  All in all if this is for a grant in the gitcoin builds gitcoin category I think this is a really good idea. Would be interested to learn more about the processes you plan to follow but that is offtopic to the proposal here.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: For example, during a recent hackathon, I think one of the sponsors committed fraud by not awarding the bounty, relying on friendly language and vague requirements.  20 submissions for the prize were all rejected with no clear explanation.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Yes these questions are great.  Thanks for the feedback, There are many criteria including names, websites, wallets and social media accounts.  Usually the entire application is scrutinized and links get followed.  We try to get a sense of the applicant.  When a team is made of OG, OG1, OG2, and there is no additional information the grant is typically flagged or denied.    Gitcoin DAO Anti-Fraud Workstream: Round 10 | Grants    Gitcoin DAO Anti-Fraud Workstream: Round 10 | Grants It began with a call…   Gitcoin was under attack…   With the weapons of knowledge, many from the ecosystem came to defend…   They built a machine learning algorithm to flag fraud…   But algorithms must be tuned to serve the needs of the community,...
